39027327.review:
The Bug Butcher is another balloon popper game, similar to games like Pang Adventure. The only difference is that instead of balloons, you have bugs. The objective is to kill all the bugs in a given level by a specified time limit. You use a machine gun called Ol'Reliable and as you kill bugs, the game will drop boxes that contain weapons such as the rocket launcher, laser beam, lightning gun and gatling gun. The game loop is as follows, play 5 levels of the same floor, go to the elevator and move to the next floor. Rinse and repeat. There are only 5 levels and the only differences between them is the artwork. You will get the same level with only walls blocking you.

Gameplay-wise, it's best to use a controller. Basically, you only need to move left and right, shoot upwards and use your special power. That's it. The special powers come in Boot Juice (where you shoot faster and become invincible), Freeze Grenade (where everything freezes), Homing Missiles (a whole bunch of missiles fly out from out from you).

Conclusion, this isn't really recommendable. The developers, Awfully Nice Studios, made only 5 levels and repeated them over and over again. I was hoping that there was going to be more, like another zone but no. Their entire scheme seems to be to entice players with good marketing and screw the content. Thus, I cannot in good faith recommend this game to anyone. They draw mechas and alien mouths but that's it. They are just drawings and not a tangible boss to fight against.

Note : Awfully Nice Studios is a 2 man team located in Kustein, Austria.

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Simple Controls
Move left and right and shoot. How much more complexity is there? You don't even need to roll, jump or slide.

2. Faster Pace Relative to Other Balloon Poppers
It's definitely more interesting compared to the slow pace of other balloon poppers.

3. The Forge Hammer
That is the only stage that I felt was different as you had to avoid the hammer crushing you. All the other stages were just the different coloured backgrounds. Even the mouth spitter didn't count.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Only 5 Levels
Seriously? That's it? For such simple gameplay, I was expecting at least 20 different levels. You drew big mechs in the background but it never came to pass. 

2. Short Game
It's over in 2 hours. 1 hour if you play easy mode.

3. Really Few Mechanically Different Enemies
Most of the enemies just bounce around like balls hitting the walls. You've only got a few interesting models like the lightning bug, scientist eater and big bouncing boss.

4. No Online Multiplayer
It's local co-op max. For a game like this, it would be a simple addition for direct hosting.

5. Repeating the Same Level
This is one of the worst sins. If all you do for every level is change the artwork in the background, at the very least, you could have updated the background each time you play another stage. To play the same level 5 times over is just bad design. A simple additional effect would have made it so much better. E.g. Alarms could go off in stage 2, mechanical arms could go haywire.

6. False Advertising
What is the deal with the mecha? I feel extremely disappointed with this one. You drew it, put it in the ad but it played no part except as a background.

37773219.review:
TL;DR Great spiritual sucessor to Super Buster Bros! Buy this game! 

I grew up playing Super Buster Bros (Aka Super Pang in Japan) I've been wanting a new instalment in the series ever since I was a kid. So I'm a bit bummed I only just heard about this game today--more than a year after its release. The vertical shooting is still here and the aliens burst just like the bubbles did in the old game on the SNES. The presentaion is solid. The Bug Butcher is quite sassy and there's a solid charm to the game. Despite some modern additions to make the game more accessible there is plently of challege here that I expect to be coming back to. I can see my self take a whirl at the harder difficulty trying to max out my scores and combos to perfection.  

I was going to wait and see if the game made it to the Nintendo Switch, as that's where I prefer to play these sorts of games, but in the sale at $2.39USD I'm more than happy to buy it now than wait indefinetly for something that might not come. Hell I'd even double dip just to have it portably.

36440597.review:
Ah, the Bug Butcher, it quickly made its way into my favorites. Why? Because it is simple and addictive little game. Older players will find the mechanics similar to the ‘Pang’ game of many, many years ago.

The premise is simple, there are creatures bouncing around and you shoot them, however when they are hit, they will split up into smaller aliens, until they are to small to further split up and only then truly die. In the very early levels this is pretty easy, but as you can imagine, more enemies will be on the playing field in later levels and things get hectic pretty fast.

It’s better then Pang in many ways. First, the enemies have attacks, which the balloons in Pang never had. That is OK because you have so many power-ups available and between levels you can upgrade your weapons, speed, armor, etc.

Secondly, The crispy hand-drawn 2D graphics are full of colors and charm, excellent animations which go hand-in-hand with excellent sound effects. The weapons all have a satisfying sound as well as the splattering-splut sound when killing aliens. Characters speak goobly gook between eachother, not sure if that was really needed, but it doesn’t take away any of the fun.

On top of the excellent single player game, you can also play this with a buddy, turn up the hectic dial to 11!

Highly recommended if you’re looking for a no-nonsense, simple, straight forward, shoot’em’up.

Works without a hitch on SteamOS/Linux, plays like a charm with the Steam Controller and streams to the Link without issues.

Классная динамичная аркада: приятная мультяшная графика и стилистика, крепкое управление, разнообразные враги, куча паверапов и оружия, можно играть вдвоём. Настраиваемая сложность (немаловажный в таких играх момент, который многие упускают). Есть режим выживания, который плавно нарастает в интенсивности вплоть до того, что весь экран начинает взрываться от твоей мощи после того как купишь все апгрейды. Для стрельбы можно нажать и держать кнопку вместо того чтобы ломать палец, как это до сих пор у некоторых принято. 

Из недостатков: короткая (вся "кампания" занимает от силы пару часов, впрочем потом можно задрачивать звёзды и режим выживания), фейсхаггеры убивают с первого раза (серьёзно, вот зачем вообще давать игроку сердечки здоровья, чтобы потом мгновенно убивать его?), нельзя перенастроить кнопки на джойстике (повесить стрельбу на триггеры), некоторые огрехи в меню (приходится переключаться на мышь иной раз, плюс ненаглядная возможность апгрейдов), режимы игры называются контр-интуитивно (кампанию надо было обозначить более явно). Ещё сюда на мой взгляд напрашиваются какие-нибудь крутые боссы как в скролл-шутерах, но авторы остановились лишь на нескольких врагах повышенной толстозадости. 

Вообще, в какой-то момент я поймал себя на мысли, что игра представляет собой занятный сплав старых-добрых "Арканоида" и "Галаксиан"/"Спейс инвейдерс" (в современной интерпретации, конечно, но без упора на буллет-хелл). Если скучаете по чему-нибудь такому - рекомендую. За свои деньги (56 рублей на распродажах) игра более чем стоящая даже на пару часов.

34448902.review:
This might be one of the best shoot 'em up games out there.
I didn't expect having as much fun with this as I did, but something about it seems to hit exactly the right spots in this genre!

It's basically Pang. Although I didn't know about Pang, I had played a rip-off game from Miniclip many years ago called Bubble Trouble.
Basically, you can only shoot up, and large enemies split into smaller enemies.  
Pang didn't have a gun, but a hook that would disappear once it hit an enemy or the ceiling, and enemies would die even by hitting the hook's "trail". In this sense, The Bug Catcher is more traditional, i.e. you have an actual gun that functions like one - although you can only shoot vertically.

The core gameplay is just really fun! But I would also say that the developers structured the game very nicely.

The core gameplay is basically predicting the enemies' arc movements to avoid them, while clearing the screen. This requires quite a lot of focus, but it's very satisfying. 
I'm focusing on the single-player missions. There is also an Endless both, both for single player and for co-op. (I actually didn't enjoy co-op very much. But I usually don't anyway? I like to concentrate on the game I'm playing and that doesn't work very well with other people, but maybe that's just me...)

The levels are a mixture of reflex and memorization, if you're going for all the objectives. 
Each level has 3 stars for score, and an additional objective to hit a X-combo. Your combo meter is incremented every time you kill an enemy, but it's reset when you don't kill any enemy for 4-6 seconds.
I think this is the part that made the game so enjoyable for me. Because in every level, you're trying to figure out the order in which to kill the enemies so that you don't lose your combo, and maximizing your score as a result. A higher combo gives you a higher score, exponentially (it seemed).

There are 5 areas. They play similarly, but each one has a different environmental hazard. One has a hammer that comes down in the center of the room, from time to time, another has breakable (and respawnable) platforms at some height, etc.
Each area has 6 levels, the 6th being a special elevator level that introduces some tougher enemies - minibosses, if you will - that will appear later in the game.

So, 30 levels in total, which took me maybe 7-7.5 hours to master. All objectives on every level. I often get frustrated when going for these "perfect" scores in most game, but not on this one. The whole time, I was focused enough and enjoying myself the whole time. That very rarely happens.

So yeah, I don't know exactly why, but this game is really, really, good. The modes designed seem to bring the best out of the core gameplay.

There are also temporary guns and powerups, which are good to give some variety to repeated retries. Temporary invincibility, freeze enemies, etc. The weapons are usually better screen clearers than your basic weapon.
You upgrade all of this, although the upgrade system is fairly shallow.

Not much weapon or power-up variety, but I honestly think it doesn't need it. The core game is that satisfying that it doesn't need much dressing up.


Not as descriptive as most of my reviews, I guess. But I don't think there's much to describe, here. The game isn't very original - mostly a derivative of Pang with some modern aspects. Yet, it works. Really well!

So yeah, definitely give it a go if the game seems up your alley. Won't change your world, but you'll probably have a great time, knowing what game to expect!

33718774.review:
The Bug Butcher has the essence of a pang game at it's core yet it manages to still break away and create a modern take on the 2d shooting genre. 

Music, sounds, animation are all of high quality. Story is pretty non existent. I didn't experience any issues or crashes. Some of the menu screens were a bit tedious to navigate around, but that's about the only annoying thing I came across. Controls are very tight (even on keyboard). You can rebind all the keys if required. 

Gameplay is pretty simple. You're able to only move left and right on the screen and only shoot up. Bugs come out in swarms and you need to break them down to destroy them. i.e kill a large bug and it breaks into 2 medium bugs, shoot them and they each break into 2 small bugs etfc Allowing you to finally kill the small bugs to clear the screen. Naturally if you shoot anything that moves the entire screen fills up with bugs making it hard to move/attack. As the levels pile on you'll get a pretty good variety of environmental obstacles and enemies with their own individual movement patterns and shooting rhythms, health stats etc.

There is a fairly large amount of weapons that randomly appear in game to utilise (including different power ups as well - like freezing enemies for a few seconds etc). The game also puts in a combo system to help create higher scores and forcing you to make a kill every few seconds to keep the combo alive. It works really well for the most part as you start to learn how to juggle the kills in a certain way for better effect. Most of the time the screen will be filled up with plenty of enemies and it's beautiful chaos. There is a pretty great feeling when you pull off a large amount of kills in a couple of seconds with a combination of skill and pure luck.

In standard mode there are 30 levels in total. Doesn't sound like much but they are all pretty replayable if you are trying to 100% the game. The last level will give you a good run for your money as it forces you to juggle just about every weapon and skill in a well timed run. There is an additional co-op mode and another single player endless horde mode. All levels have global scores to see where you rank in the world. General game time to complete story mode would probably be under 4 hours (based on average difficulty), to 100% the game it took me about 5-6hrs. All achievements popped without any issues. While it would be nice to see additional levels, I've read the game hasn't sold well enough to break even/justify further development work. I feel there is easily enough content to justify the current asking price as it's quality over quantity (and it's under $10).

If you are purely in it for single player story mode and are not worried about achievements/co-op I'd probably recommend waiting for a sale. If you like to try 100% the game or have a buddy to play with then I'd recommend giving it a go. It's a fair price and It runs really well. There is no long loading times. The level of polish is impressive for an indie game, get on it! Way better than any other pang game on steam.

About all there is to this game is a smug bug exterminator and his two screaming scientist pals that flail their arms while you lay down the mothertrucking law on some gawddurn bugs--and bouncing lava balls... I don't understand what the hell those are doing in here actually, they make no sense.

At its core is a remake of the old 90s game Pang/Buster Bros.  They've added a dash, more personality, and MOTHERTRUCKING DROOLY BUGS.

Pros:
Difficulty selection
Upgrades
Bugs
Shiny art

Cons:
Holding down dash and releasing move leaves you dashing in the direction you tapped
No online multi, the game didn't sell well enough (yet?) according to the dev's own postings

Solution: Buy the game by giving them your money, demand on the discussion board that they add online modes and embrace the light if enough people do it.

31014102.review:
Awfully Nice Studios, una empresa indie liderada por dos personas, que trabajaron anteriormente en Blizzard, Till Aschewanden y Rainer Zoettl. Y esta empresa ha creado ‘‘THE BUG BUTCHER’’, un videojuego al estilo Pang! solo que en vez de disparar a pelotas, disparas a unas especies de aliens que parecen ser un poco... Vayamos un poquito más atrás en la época de las recreativas...

En la época de las recrativas hubo franquicias con varios géneros, pero los más jugados eran los Beat’em up  como Metal Slug, The Punisher, Golden Axe... y muchos más, pero tambien hubo otros géneros como los juegos de plataformas, los más clasicos de los juegos de arcade y una de ellas era el Super Pang!. Super Pang! es un juego de Puzzles y Plataformas que su objetivo es que al reventar todas las pelotas y pasar de nivel. THE BUG BUTCHER visualmente tiene la misma temática solo que tiene un toque más cómico y tiene unas mécanicas totalmente distintas. Esas mecánicas son referidas a que los mapas no tienen escaleras por donde subir, consta de varios tipos de power-ups, armas y habilidades activas. Los power-ups son los objetos que te aparecen cuando destruyes a un enemigo, ellos te proporcionaran velocidad de disparo o mas daño. A parte de que puedes mejorar esos power-ups (solamente en duración) comprándolos con las monedas que consigues al acabar un escenario.

En conclusión, "THE BUG BUTCHER" me ha llevado pocas horas terminarlo en modo campaña, me hubiese gustado que hubiese durado más, pero no se dió la ocasión. Es un juego para todos los públicos, rápido, cómico y rejugable.

29049690.review:
Addicting, wave-based pulse rifle action. The Bug Butcher is a simple game, and what you see from the screenshots and trailer is exactly what you'll get. I blasted through the game in seven hours and enjoyed all of it, but probably wouldn't return for an extended session of mowing down bugs with laser gatlings.

Pros:
+ Sleek and modern artstyle, dashing around is fun
+ Slaughtering bugs feels satisfying, regardless of weaponry
+ Reasonable amount of content - 30 campaign missions plus Endless
+ Sense of progression via perks, weapon unlocks, etc
+ Game runs well with keyboard or gamepad, I used the former
+ Seriously, the Laser Gun. Good grief.

Cons:
- Endless mode not as good as it could be, feels shallow
- Local co-op not supported in campaign, only endless. Feels like an afterthought
- Those purple blowhards that leap onto you for the instakill

Some of the top ranks are fun to chase in the campaign, and the hard difficulty reduces you to one health point and a pair of boxers. Do you think Maximo might be moonlighting as an alien exterminator after his PS2 glory days?

I'm nitpicking a bit with the drawbacks up there, because The Bug Butcher really is a fine example of a game that has a simple, addictive premise and executes it perfectly. It feels responsive, stylish and is simple to pick up and play for just a few levels at a time. Definitely recommended!

28575840.review:
The Bug Butcher è un simpatico arcade shooter che strizza l'occhio ad un classico da sala giochi degli anni '90: il famoso Super Pang! - un gioco che da bambino mi ha fatto tirare più di un paio di pugni ai cabinati per via della difficoltà a tratti frustrante (... a cui ero solito dare la colpa per coprire le mie palesi lacune tecniche). Laddove in Super Pang ci trovavamo a colpire palloni colorati, The Bug Butcher ci vede nei panni di una specie di impresa di disinfestazione alle prese con l'eradicazione di diverse tipologie di insetti spaziali varipinti. 

Vi sono sostanzialmente due modalità di gioco: una modalità arcade, in cui affronteremo progressivamente 5 macro aree suddivise in 6 livelli ciascuno, e una modalità Panic, una sorta di endless mode in cui l'obiettivo principale sarà quello di migliorare il proprio record di punteggio per scalare così la leaderbord. La modalità arcade permette di raccogliere monete che potranno essere impiegate per acquistare miglioramenti alle armi (partiamo con un'arma standard ma nell'arco del gioco troveremo casse contenenti mitragliatrici, laser, razzi e chi più ne ha più ne metta) o alle abilità speciali del nostro personaggio (invincibilità, congelamento dei nemici, ecc.); nella modalità Panic invece armi addizionali e abilità speciali non verranno generati finché non saranno stati sbloccati, acquistandoli tra una wave di nemici e l'altra utilizzando il denaro a disposizione.

Il gioco ha un gameplay molto fluido e veloce, che come ogni gioco di ispirazione neo-arcade richiede una buona dose di coordinazione e di reattività - in particolare la presenza delle combo temporizzate richiede ad alti livelli una certa propensione al rischio che molto spesso finirà col metterci nei guai. A differenza di Super Pang! però la maledetta "morte al tocco" è stata eliminata, sostituita da una barra vitale che ci permetterà di prendere qualche prioettile prima di passare a miglior vita.

Se da un lato il gameplay è veramente ottimo, dall'altro il comparto audio-video non è sempre all'altezza. In particolare mi dispiace notare la superficialità dell'interfaccia utente (che ha il difetto aggiuntivo di essere pensata per la navigazione con il gamepad): non sono abituato a giudicare il libro dalla copertina, ma se avessi adottato questo approccio con The Bug Butcher probabilmente a quest'ora non starei scrivendo questa recensione positiva. Lo stile semi-cartoonesco generale funziona a metà, e questo perchè modelli 2D e animazioni non sono sempre fluidi e ben realizzati. Ciò non toglie che in generale l'esperienza visiva rimane comunque positiva e abbastanza piacevole.

Consigliato a tutti, ma soprattutto a quella piccola cerchia di masochisti affezionati a Super Pang! - ad un costo irrisorio troverete (di nuovo) pane per i vostri denti!

[i][b]Se questa recensione ti è piaciuta clicca "Segui" sulla [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogamingcafe/curation]pagina del Curatore[/url] del mio gruppo: sarai sempre aggiornato con i miei personali consigli e le recensioni dei migliori titoli indie/retro/roguelite in circolazione![/b][/i]

Played the game on Ubuntu Gnome 16.04 with Logitech 710 gamepad (Xpad driver) and I can say that it plays without any problems. Since I got it on sale (3.99 €) it is very good value for money.

Bug Butcher is basically a Pang in a sci-fi environment with really nice cartoony graphics and tight controls on a controller. It is suitable for short daily bursts of play which is a major plus for me. The difficulty is also nicely balanced, it wasn't too easy with some levels taking more than 20 attempts to beat. Game has a local co-op so you can enjoy it with your family/friends.

This is just my kind of game: simple addictive mechanic, nice graphics, tight controls and can be played in short bursts.

Highly recommended.

26601700.review:
This game is different from all other 3rd person shooting games. playing from a side view shooting enemies above you seems easy, but isn't. It requires amazing skill to dodge all enemies even with maxed out abilities. Easy to learn, yet hard to master. That's this game in 1 sentence. One of the most amazing games I have met in a long time.

Although there have been some things that really dissapointed me. I have lost all my progress and all my time and effort I put into this game. all upgrades I had: gone. All levels I had completed and all the stars I had gotten: gone. This really dissappointed me and almost made me hate this game. But after picking it up again, and working back to where I was, I saw the beauty of the game again. It's incredibly satisfying seeing the enemies 'explode'. If I had the time, I would watch enemies 'exploding' all day long.

Every enemy is different, moves in a different way, has certain abilities and you can predict all of their moves, almost nothing is random, and yet even with this in mind, the game makes it difficult for you. Yet you keep trying and trying again, untill you beat it. The enemy's come from different angles and move in different directions, keeping track off all of them and avoiding them can be near impossible. Weapon crates make this easier but you need to use them at the right time, just like with the abilities you get for hitting enemies, wrong timing can lead to death. The right timing can clear the entire level and allow you to breath.

An amazing game where skill, spatial awareness and timing are key to succes.

Yes, I did get it on 50% off, but did that change my decision? no! It's worth the full 100% of the price. I was so happy with this game I even bought a copy for a friend, for him to enjoy.

10/10, would definitely 100% play again.

26342097.review:
[b]Increible y super adictivo[/b]

Una variante del clásico Pang! que a mí parecer le supera en absolutamente todo. 

[u]Cosas positivas a destacar : [/u]
[list]
[*] Geniales diseños de escenarios, personajes y enemigos tipo cartoon. Animaciones  muy trabajadas y visualmente brillantes.
[*] Cada nivel consta de 3 objetivos de puntuación (1, 2 y 3 estrellas al llegar a X puntos) y un objetivo adicional de combo (alcanzar X muertes seguidas sin recibir daño)
[*] Jugabilidad muy sencilla con mecánicas sólidas y efectivas. Básicamente el juego se controla con dos direcciones (izquierda y derecha) y 3 botones : Disparar, Deslizarse (dash) y activar power up.
[*] Excelentes power ups (sobre todo el de inmunidad acompañado de un sonido gracioso) 
[*] Brillante diseño de niveles 
[*] Banda sonora pegazida. Muy buenos efectos sonoros, sobre todo de las distintas armas y enemigos.
[*] Los logros son entretenidos de alcanzar y algunos te harán rejugar ciertos niveles de otra forma. Para alcanzar los 31 creo que he necesitado unas 12h aprox. 
[*] La modadilidad arcade también resulta muy adictiva. Me faltó probar el modo cooperativo
[*] Excelente control con sabor a arcade clásico. Recomiendo jugarlo con un arcade stick (Yo lo he jugado con un Razer Atrox de Xbox One + cronusmax)
[/list]

[u]Cosas negativas a destacar : [/u]
[list]
[*] Que no tenga más niveles (son 5 mundos con 6 niveles cada uno). 
[*] Nada más, es cojonudo. A que esperas para comprarlo ?
[/list]

En resumen, si te gustan los arcades clásicos y en especial los juegos tipo Pang, para mí este es actualmente el mejor juego de este estilo. Muy recomendado. 10/10

26276997.review:
Curieux des shooters aux faux airs de plateformer, ce petit jeu de zigouille-aliens (qui ne se prend pas trop au sérieux) a tout d'un défouloir facile à prendre en main :
on est limité en mouvement et c'est voulu par le gameplay. Ainsi, on ne peut que "strafer" de gauche à droite et tirer vers le haut sur des ennemis qui rebondissent. Et pourtant le titre est assez bien pensé pour donner des parties vitaminées où on tire en joyeuses rafales sur les cafards de l'espace tout en défendant notre pote technicien.

Adepte du coop, j'avais aussi vu un mode 2 joueurs possible ; hélàs, celui-ci n'est pas très développé : pas de mode histoire en coop, on se retrouve limité à 5 tableaux juste pour y faire du high score, c'est donc plutôt léger pour prétendre à cette appellation...

The Bug Butcher est plutôt sympa du côté solo et gérer des timing serrés face aux vagues d'aliens vous incitera à réaliser des perfect sur chaque map, mais ça ne coûtait pas grand chose d'en faire un jeu coopératif à 2 qui l'aurait rendu bien plus fun.

26075737.review:
The Bug Butcher is an arcade style Shoot’Em Up that’s inspired on the classic game Super Pang. Instead of shooting boring balloons you shoot bugs. The game is a fast action game where your reflexes are important. You can go from left to right and always shoot upwards. The more you play the game the more coins you earn. With the coins you can upgrade your equipment and moves.
The point of the game is getting a good high score. When you have all the upgrades with practice all the achievements are doable in Single-player.

+ the game has nice graphics and good music and sound effects
+ after finishing it you can try higher difficulty and getting a high score on the Steam Leader 
   boards
+ it’s quite addictive, but a little short
+ it’s worth its full price of € 7,99

It’s a fun little game to pass some dull moments, once you start you’ll keep playing. 
I recommend this game!

26024561.review: Oh yeah. The Bug Butcher est cool jusque dans son nom. C’est une chose de reprendre un bon concept, c’en est encore une autre que de le rendre si meilleur que l’original. Déjà, The Bug Butcher est joli - mais ça, un rapide coup d’oeil à ses captures d’écran vous l’a déjà fait comprendre. Ensuite, son gameplay est impeccable. C’est un régal que d’exploser un à un les monstres qui nous rebondissent au-dessus de la tête. Les musiques sont terriblement entraînantes et les effets sonores donnent du punch à chaque impact. La chasse du score pourra vous occuper longtemps, autant que le multijoueur en local vous bouffera des heures et des heures de coopération. Sa courte durée de vie est très facile à quadrupler. The Bug Butcher est un jeu auquel on joue, puis on y rejoue, on le lance une avant-dernière fois et on y rejoue encore. Finalement, il ne nous quittera jamais tout à fait et deviendra, à force de cliquer sur le bouton [i]jouer[/i], le compagnon idéal des petits trous dans nos emplois du temps. Et s’il en faut, des trous, on lui en fera. Des 'ptits, des 'ptits, et même des gros, partout. Un jeu arcade jusque dans ses viscères.

25388473.review:
The Bug Butcher is a beautiful, addictive videogame, that will fill your screen with gorgeous visuals & fantastic characters & Enemies.

Having watched the trailer for it. It immediately reminded me of the classic Super Pang game from my old Snes days. So I decided to go for it. And from the opening scene, where our hero arrives from space in his ship to this facility overrun by giant bugs. I knew immediately that I had just took a chance on something special. 

The love that has went into this game is extraordinary. Anyone who tries out the demo will know immediately that these developers put everything into it that they possibly could (amazingly all 2 of them, this blows my mind). 

From, 
the splendid backgrounds,
Local co-op (is a blast) 
Awesome slick game controls, 
funny dialogue between the hero and the lab worker,
Fantastic bug designs,
Clever power ups,
Upgrade system through currency collected in-game,
Well done difficulty progression,
Very good soundtrack,
And most importantly, the outstanding gameplay,
There will most definitely be a lot of fun to be had for everyone in this game.

Like I said before I loved Super pang back in the 90's as a child. I played it a lot! This game offers so much more than it ever could. And improves upon it in every way possible.

And for that price? I would call this a steal. Would have happily paid $20 for this. A well-made, fun and very addictive arcade game, that has nothing negative of note to write about. You can't say that for many games made these days, anymore.

A MUST OWN

25379631.review:
Bardzo przyjemna gierka.
Miła dla oka grafika 2D, ciekawe bronie i przeciwnicy. Fabuła niby miałka (jak to w tego typu grach), ale mimo to twórcom udało się i tutaj wpleść zabawne dialogi.
Polecam przede wszystkim fanom gier serii Metal Slug, ponieważ jest to bardzo podobny typ gry. Jedyna różnica to to, że zamiast przechodzić dużych lokacji, bronimy kolejnych pokoi w myśl idei 'wave defense'.
Przyjemna dla ucha muzyka sprawia, że aż nie chce się kończyć levelu.
Na szczęście tutaj z pomocą przychodzi tryb Panic (inna nazwa dla 'endless'), gdzie umiejętny gracz może przetrwać przez kilka utworów!
A jak jesteś pro elo koksem, to spróbuj przebić się przez wszystkie 30 poziomów popylając w samych majciochach!

Mam nadzieję, że twórcy wypuszczą drugą część, już bardziej w stylu "Side Scroller", właśnie jak Metal Slug!

25238942.review:
Gostei do [i]The Bug Butcher[/i] e recomendo fortemente pra quem curte jogos do gênero.

De início não parecia muito atraente: ritmo do jogo lento, primeiras fases muito fáceis, apenas 5 botões (direcional, tiro, dash e powerup) e você podendo só atirar pra cima. Porém com o decorrer dos níves, o jogo vai ficando acelerado, as fases vão ficando mais e mais desafiadoras, você vai pegando o jeito e ele fica cada vez mais divertido.

O que mais me agradou:

- Visual: cartunizado, limpo, bem agradável aos olhos. O layout dos menus, a atmosfera e os efeitos visuais dos powerups/armas são bonitos.

- Aúdio: o som das armas e dos powerups ficaram grudados na minha cabeça. Usar a metralhadora não é a mais eficiente das armas, mas sem dúvidas é a mais divertida por causa desse quesito aí..rs. A trilha sonora é bem agitada em algumas fases, não enjoa e te dá aquela empolgação extra pra realizar um combo daora. Poderiam disponibilizar a soundtrack na Steam, eu compraria.

- Jogabilidade: os comandos são bem fluidos e até a posição de jogar é bem tranquila (A, D, ctrl direito, shift direito e barra de espaço); não precisa ficar apertando e soltando o botão de tiro (é só sentar o dedo e ser feliz);

- Fator Replay: depois que você aprimora algo, vai querer dar uma repassada naquela fase porca que você passou só com uma estrela. Mais pra frente vai ficar curioso em querer fazer algumas conquistas e vai se divertir tentando fazer elas (ou passar raiva). Depois, vai querer tentar aquele combo x50 que não conseguiu e por aí vai.

O que não curti muito:

- História: poderia ter sido melhor trabalhado. Não é ruim, mas ficou aquela sensação de que ficou faltando alguma coisa no final.

- Ausência do modo multiplayer: ok, já adquiri sabendo que não teria esse modo, mas depois que você se diverte com o jogo, bate aquela decepção por não ter como jogar por esse modo (disappointed, but not surprised)

- Alguns coisas bobas menores do tipo: você tá lá jogando, dá um pause e clica pra voltar no botão errado, tcharam, volta pro menu sem confirmação nenhuma; o tutorial que no começo não dava certo pra mim de jeito nenhum (por um erro de configuração já inicial do jogo), tive que voltar pro menu e ajeitar.

No geral, ótimo jogo. E novamente, recomendo!

24947992.review:
这是一个轻松休闲的横向射击游戏。作为一个手残玩家，断断续续打了8个多小时终于全成就了，好评！

优点：
1.自带简中。
2.上手简单，键盘也能愉快玩耍，画风也还算讨喜。
3.难度有3种，可以自己选择，就算全成就也不需要最高难度通关之类的。
4.游戏中可以拾取武器箱获得更强大更酷炫的武器，打怪物积累能量会随机获得三种大招之一。
5.怪物品种丰富，攻击方式也多样化，有的怪物用子弹可以“顶”着打，有的怪物则无视子弹的反作用力，必须用游击打法，还有一种是可以一招秒杀你的，不躲开满血也得死。
6.大多数成就比较容易达成，个人认为比较难的就是第5大关的全3星+连击数达标。

缺点：
1.音乐比较单调枯燥。
2.人物只能左右移动，不能跳不能蹲，可以冲刺但是冲刺后有冷却时间，且冲刺的时候不能射击。
3.有少量bug，比如有的怪物会卡在地上还打不了，每次经过都会掉血；个别成就的判定也有小bug，可以加以利用来达成某些比较麻烦的成就。
4.游戏打到后期，武器和技能全部都升到满级，剩下一大堆金币没地儿花，不如出一点一次性道具，不然金币放那儿没有意义了。

评分：8/10。

24831044.review:
[b]IL GIOCO[/b] > Essenzialmente questo gioco è uno sparatutto (per molti versi simile a Super Pang!) dove il vostro personaggio è in grado di muoversi solamente a destra o a sinistra, sparando verso l'alto ai mostri che compaiono, ondata dopo ondata, sullo schermo. Data l'impossibilità di sparare a destra o a sinistra, gli insetti che ci troveremo a affrontare essenzialmente rimbalzano o saltano sullo schermo, permettendoci così di poterli friggere (che gentili X-D). Nei vari livelli che compongono il gioco è possibile sfruttare bonus di vario genere (come ad esempio il ghiaccio, che letteralmente congela i nemici sullo schermo, o i missili, che partono in tutte le direzioni alla ricerca di bersagli) e armi, rendendo più divertente e varia l'esperienza di gioco. Ovviamente, com'è facile aspettarsi, man mano che si avanza nel gioco i mostri diventano sempre più agguerriti e mortali, così come iniziano a comparire ostacoli di vario genere negli stage - presse pronte a schiacciarci, fiamme dalle pareti e muri di energia sono soltanto alcune delle cose che tenteranno di metterci i bastoni tra le ruote. Il gioco presenta varie modalità di gioco: la modalità standard, l'Arcade, suddivisa in 5 sezioni da 6 stage, durante la quale si guadagnano soldi per potenziare il proprio personaggio e si tenta di fare il punteggio più alto possibile per scalare le classifiche (o guadagnare le stelle per gli achievements, raggiungendo determinati obiettivi di combo e punteggio negli stessi stage), e la modalità Panic, giocabile anche in cooperativa, dove si tenta di andare il più avanti possibile affrontando ondate continue, anche qui guadagnando soldi per potenziare il proprio personaggio dopo ogni ondata.

[b]PRO E CONTRO[/b] > Tanti, tantissimi pro. Il gioco è fluido, veloce, animato benissimo, si controlla come dio comanda ed è dannatamente divertente da giocare. Il gioco rende bene già dai filmati qui su Steam, ma giocandoci ci si accorge di quanta cura sia stata riposta dietro al suo sviluppo. A tal proposito, peccato che sia praticamente sconosciuto ai più - è una di quelle classiche "perle nascoste" che fa sempre piacere scoprire. Se proprio si vuole cercare un contro, direi la lunghezza: gli stage in modalità Arcade si finiscono presto (specie se non puntate a fare le stelle), e la modalità Panic è ripetitiva alla lunga senza qualcuno con cui giocare - io in meno di 7 ore ho ottenuto tutti gli achievements, e in questo tempo sono comprese anche alcune partite fatte in modalità Panic. Ma, a parte questo piccolo particolare, il gioco merita davvero.

[b]- PRO -[/b]

[list]
[*]Veloce, fluido, animato benissimo, graficamente molto bello da vedere.
[*]Molto divertente e appagante.
[*]Una piccola perla purtroppo sconosciuta.
[/list]

[b]- CONTRO -[/b]

[list]
[*]Piuttosto corto.
[/list]

Let me first make it clear that despite the NOT RECOMMENDED vote, the game is actually pretty good. It's just a fire and forget game that you won't launch more than 2-3 times because they just use up all the fireworks right at the start and you can know for sure what you've seen so far is what will repeat in the next hours / dozen hours / whatever you spend with it. 

And I tend to look back at these purchases with regret. If I'd have the Bug Butcher on my phone, I would likely play it for weeks every day, because the animation and drawing style are really good (reminds me Carbot Animations and their Blizzard games related animated series which are excellent and being compared to that is a huge compliment), the gameplay is fun and fluid, but after not even 2 hours I feel like this isn't a game I want to spend precious workdays free time with while weekends are usually saved for larger scope games. Any way I look at it, I just don't want to play this game anymore, and after 95 minutes through 3 sessions, that's... I just can't honestly recommend it.

24468453.review:
What an amazing game. It relies on the good old PANG type of gameplay, but adding elements from games like Contra, Metal Slug... and weapon/extras leveling using the coins every enemy drops through the game. It also includes a nice kills combo system, for good measure.

The artstyle and controls are top notch, on the same level as indie hits like the Behemoth games, or multimillion productions from Ubisoft...

I particularly enjoyed the difficulty: the game lets you play it with ease, but keeps getting harder, to the point where you are playing a bullet hell title, but not to the point of frustration.

I hope this game gets the attention it deserves. There are too many games shilled everyday on youtube and blogs that look like a weekend hack job, or just a weird idea that spawns a thousand ripoffs. 

this is the most solid indie title that i have seen in a long while. 

looking forward for more from this guys, cheers
9/10

24433573.review:
Most retro inspired games fail just because they don't get the core mechanics right, but The Bug Butcher nails them in a way that surpasses the Pang games it replicates.

This is basically Pang on steroids with super tight controls, gorgeous graphics (except for a couple of choppy animations) and a grading system that keeps the game interesting while allowing for some replayability.

It's a shame it doesn't have a bit more content (where's the hook gun?) and online/versus modes, because it's one of the best arcade games I've played on Steam.

PS: also, the menus are terrible, but it's not a big deal.

23998681.review:
Strepitoso. E' un arcade shooter in 2D che offre momenti di pura tecnica. Avete presente quando riconoscete il gunplay in un fps ? L'effetto delle armi e dei colpi ? Qui è la stessa cosa, laser o razzi, avrete modo di sentire tutti i vostri colpi sui nemici. Una scivolata (aggiunta in seguito) permette movimenti veloci nei vari livelli resi sempre divertenti da una direzione artistica molto buona e strepitose animazioni. L'azione furiosa, è allo stesso tempo sempre ragionata, con un tasso di sfida via via sempre più elevato.
Quasi inspiegabile il prezzo così basso rispetto a quello che viene offerto. Pensare che i devs (tra essi, due ex Blizzard) hanno ammesso che lo scarso successo di The Bug Butcher su Steam non ha permesso loro di includere alcune features.
E' un raro esempio di un gran gioco partito con Greenlight, proseguito in Early Access e poi, una volta sullo Store in versione definitiva....persosi come altre centinaia di indie games. 
Da (ri)scoprire.

23985292.review:
The Bug Butcher is a modernized take on the Pang/Buster Bros formula turned up to 11. The cartoony Sci-Fi action setting with nice high definition sprite art and the hit and miss humor gives the game much more of a personality than the games that inspired it. 

It has the responsive controls that this kind of game requires and the several game modes and a permanent upgrade progression system adds to the replayability. 

The only real gripe I have with the game is that I think they could make the user interface a bit easier to overview and navigate.

23980570.review:
92 minutes. Is what it took me to "beat" the game on easy. Got almost all upgrades, etc.
So if you are looking for long term motivation, I doubt this is the game for you. If you just wanna have a good (short) time, or if you're a completionist and want to 3 star every level on the hardest difficulty, then just get it. It's cheap anyway and only developed by a few people.

Basically it's the evolution of space invaders, with interesting levels that make the game more challenging, as well as a variety of different enemies, which, combined, can really mess up your day.

You can only shoot up with your basic machine gun. Periodically the game will spawn power ups and weapon pick ups, like beam gun, lightning gun, health...you also gain a random power up after you've dealt enough carnage, like freeze all enemies, or become invulnerable, etc.

All of these can be upgraded in the "campaign" mode. There's also an arcade mode, which seems like an "endless shooter"? Dunno. You seem to be able to upgrade on the fly here.

Anyway, nice little indie game from mobile. Could use a bit more content though, imho. Maybe different characters, some more levels and modes, etc. However, I think it is way too expensive for what it offers. Got it during a 50% sale now and I dunno. There are games out there for 5 bucks which offer you a lot more. You need to decide.

23503398.review:
This day and age, 2D games seem to be rapidly becoming the norm with new game developers starting off their careers with a 2D side-scroller. There’s a market for these high-quality, retro-style titles – just look at our coverage over the last week, two of the main titles were Axel The Penguin and The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human. Fair enough, these aren’t necessarily the first games the devs have created, but they are certainly ones that got them noticed. The Bug Butcher is one.

The Bug Butcher is a nice 2D game by Awfully Nice Studios with fluid animations, a fancy soundtrack, and a cartoon-themed art style, it follows the protagonist – “Harry” – as he embarks on an assignment to a planet know as Zolt, proving his worth as a bug destroying expert, The scientists on the planet hired him because their numbers are dropping… like flies;   and to kill the various bug monsters that are slaughtering them all, Harry must kill the bugs…like flies.

Your aim, kill all the bugs, collect all the coins, and save the scientists. Sounds like a nice little story, and fair enough, it’s a nice little game! It boasts similarities to other games wherein the player can only fire upwards, just like Space Invaders, or a vertical version of R-Type.

It looks slightly like, Alien Hominid, remember that? The Bug Butcher seems very based on it, with similar art styles, similar interfaces, but with more modern, sleek graphics, and more bugs.

Read the rest: http://bigbossbattle.com/review-the-bug-butcher/

22971621.review:
TRY THE DEMO FIRST! One look and you're thinking "Castle Crashers with guns?" that's about right. It has a similar feel but can't beat Castle Crashers (A+++). This was made to be a frantic heart-pounding game due to a deadly threat. Your immersion is based on reaction, timing and power. But the game just keeps breaking it's own rhythm with forced pauses and inability. A great looking game (Solid B) but loaded with petty gameplay flaws; Buy it on sale.

Top 5 Cons=
One Hit Kills: The game is on easy. I have eight life. Why do we have monsters that kill me in one hit for no reason? In fact, most of my Cons are based on this kind of mob since I have such a limited way to fight them. Easy=/=instadeath.

You Can Only Shoot in One Direction (up): This is an intentional game design decision that is just painful and crippling. Being unable to shoot at angles or just in front of you breaks immersion; especially when you have a bug standing right next to you. Maybe they did it so you can't just laser the whole room? /shrug Sure... but they could have just made a limit to the laser range.

Bug Boys Can't Jump: When you have a bug standing right next to you while commanding the powers of Ice Gernades and a Laser imbued with pure deadly hellfire, but can't jump over an immobile bug that is in your way... /sigh... You get crippling immersion breaking again.

No Seemless Transition: You finish a "room". The score pops. Fade to black. Load the next "room" in the same "room". I should be running from room to room or never leave the same room since the background stays the same. The game shouldn't need to stop and reload for each level. Just have me walk into the next room on the same floor or signal to begin the next phase in the same room. My immersion ends with each "room" completion. Castle Crashers got this right with side scrolling, how did Bug Butcher get this wrong? 

Upgrades vs Difficulty vs The Timer: I should be able to keep my upgrades regardless of the difficulty. The difficulty should effect my cash rewards. I shouldn't be able to upgrade my weapon only twice depending on the difficulty. My timer should be based on my abilities to keep it balanced. All of these things were not made to work with each other. They are each a part of the whole, when they should be one whole organism with co-dependant organs.

The Good Stuff=
5. The Art: Looks great but not enough of it. I just see the same fantastic background for too many rooms.  

4. The Controls: Seemless reaction time and configureable layouts. The game fits to you, not the other way around.

3. The Combat: This is where you fall in love with frantic heart-pounding. The power-ups and weapons were well thought out. Their balance give each weapon a personality rather than a weakness, Wanted to outrun bugs with normal movement though.

2. The Animation: I dont feel like I'm seeing mobs. I feel like I'm seeing "real" bug/monster movement for their universe. In a way, this is so good it is bad. This gives you the most immersion (IMO).

1. Epic Music. The trailer song "Two Steps From Hell-Invincible" played and you knew you had just been hooked with an AMV (Animated music video). If this didn't follow up the actual game with epic and/or techno music the only answer would be righteous fury for such a sin. Thank you for all the ear orgasims.

过年的时候偶然的机会看到这款小游戏，把玩了一下发现汉化质量很差（机翻）并且发现了几个很严重的BUG，好心联系开发者Rainer，想帮助他完善这款游戏，Rainer欣然同意还支付我工资，第一次能为独立游戏做汉化其实超级开心，还能赚到欧元。。。。。。

虽然汉化文本不大，但是也是我反反复复日日夜夜自己推敲出来的，反复玩了很多遍游戏才敢去确定汉化文本。

这次汉化是完全汉化，所有界面和菜单都有汉化。

如有汉化错误和BUG欢迎大家指正。我手头没手柄，如果有手柄适配的bug请在评论下方回复手柄型号和详情bug，谢谢。

PS:故事的模式的怪物是有限的，想体验更多怪物请试玩无尽模式。音乐十分带感。动词打次根本停不下来。

已知缺陷：
1.游戏对话中有些许空格。如果没有空格就会不适配对话框，所以各位中文玩家请见谅，不会影响阅读。
2.无尽模式中游戏结束的结算画面Wave显示汉化不正确。

22588825.review:
Un mixto entre Glorkian Warrior y Super Pang, tanto jugabilidad como ambientación. Super pang es el mítico juego de bolas botando de las recreativas y Glorkian es una evolución Indie de los juegos de marcianitos por oleadas afectadas por el tiempo o número de enemigos restantes.

Aquí se ha puesto especial cuidado en el diseño de los escenarios y enemigos en relación a nuestro personaje. Son casi 30 niveles de 4 minutos, divididos en 5 episodios. Cada episodio es un escenario de juego distinto con sus elementos característicos, muy pocos representativos pero con un acople superior hacia la jugabilidad. El juego es jugabilidad pura potenciada, se podría decir.

Todo ha sido planteado para ofrecer un desafio al jugador muy jugable y muy equilibrado, ausente de forzamientos. Esto por contra ocasiona que el juego sea totalmente breve en todo; trabajan centrándose en la calidad, potenciándola a su vez que anulan su complegidad en todo. 

Si Super Pang o Glorkian Warrior tuvieran una continuación antes aprenderian de este juego. Sin embargo las 4 horas que me ha llevado completarlo al 100% pueden llevar a discusión una buena compra. 4 horas tiene el juego para verlo todo y dominar el juego por completo.

22575688.review:
Este juego es una maravilla. Es lo más parecido al clásico "Pang" que vas a encontrar en Steam; y sí, por si te lo estás preguntando, es mucho mejor que el reciente "Pang Adventures".

+ Parecido al Pang, aunque con estilo propio.
+ 60 fps.
+ Varias armas y mejoras.
+ Diversos monstruos, con jefes de vez en cuando.
+ Puedes esprintar, lo cual amplía las posibilidades de salir ileso de situaciones comprometidas.
+ Jugabilidad frenética.
+ Gráficos razonablemente buenos; nada de retro-tonterías de esas que tanto salen ahora.
+ Cooperativo local.
+ Buena música.
+ Precio razonable.
+ Muy muy divertido y gracioso.

- No tiene cooperativo en línea.
- El cooperativo local está limitado al "modo infinito", quedando vedado el "modo historia".
- Que no tenga muchísimos más niveles.

Cómpralo si antaño te gustó el Pang y, sobre todo, tienes a alguien con quien jugar en casa.

プレイ深度: 1-2時間程度

おすすめしませんの方に入れてしまったが極めておすすめ寄り
完全にダメってことは全然なく基本的には面白い
すごく惜しいゲーム！

往年の名作「Super Pang」リスペクトゲーム
よくまとまっており面白いのだが、Super Pangを期待して購入するとすごく肩透かしを受けるだろう
似て非なるものだと思ったほうがいい

一番違うのは「コンボ要素」　一定時間内にターゲットを壊し続けると
スコアが劇的に伸びていくってよくあるあれ

これが若干厄介で各ステージに規定コンボ数が決められてて
ステージ構成的に繋がりにくかったりすることがたまにあって
基本的には良い要素だと思っていて
好意的に見れるんだけど、ついムキになって取りに行ったり　コンボ切れたらretryみたいな
それを意識するばっかりにストレスが溜まることがなくはない

1Pモード
ステージギミックに関してはステージ20くらい遊んだ程度では

* 敵が足場に使う破壊できる床
* 横から炎が出てダメージを与える

Super Pangのようにステージ構成が極めてよく考えられ、練られているわけではなくて
壊れる壁や隠しアイテムを探してステージを解く楽しみは全く無く
なんとなく似たようなステージを遊び続けることになり若干冗長

パニックモード
waveで敵を倒し拾ったコインでアイテムを買って次のステージへって
よくあるあれ
super pangの ☆玉をいつ割るのかなどのような「狙い撃つ」という部分は削ぎ落とされており
とにかく撃って、走って、避けるたまに買い物する


総評
なんだかsuper pangと対比の話ばかりになってしまったが
とりあえずターゲットの優先度なんか考えないで

撃って、走って、避ける

みたいな遊び方をする分には小粒ながら楽しく遊べるとおもう。

俺はsuper pangのほうが好きです。

22094201.review:
The Bug Butcher is a fun to play game, casually and hardcore, too.

Why is that? It's a pretty classic game, the controls are really easy, it has a lot of progress (upgrading weapons, power ups and other things), lots of levels and is just really fun to play casually, just killing the damned bugs. Enemy variety is good, and they all have their unique attacks and movement patterns. The level design isn't what I'd call especially innovative, but they look very nice (and I have not finished the game yet, so there might be more coming). Part of this is due to the lack of platforming elements, so the room for innovation is actually pretty small.

Hardcore gamers get chances to optimize their scores and clear times. The enemy spawns in the levels are always the same, so that you can memorize them and optimize your play, gaining combos and higher scores.

If you don't do that, a first playthrough can be done in about 2-4 hours.

To round it up, there is an endless game mode, which I haven't delved into yet.

All in all I'd definitely recommend this game!

21954869.review: Conoscete Pang ?Il gioco in cui un ragazzino doveva colpire dei palloncini senza farsi toccare e una volta colpiti questi diventavano sempre più piccoli ?.Ecco,prendete Pang,togliete i palloncini e mettete gli alieni,il risultato sará The Bug ButcherLa grafica in 2D di questo gioco è semplicemente deliziosa e gli alieni hanno pattern molto diversificati e sono molto vari.L'unica pecca è l'ambientazione,che è poco varia,si aggiungeranno dei piccolo elementi nuovi solo nei livelli più avanzati.Il gioco ha solo tre modalitá:Arcade,Survival e la coop-locale.Nella modalitá arcade dovrete affrontare diverse ondate e avrete a disposizione un tot do tempo,finito il quale sará game over.Fortunatamente il nostro eroe potrá ricevere diversi oggetti dai nemici uccisi :soldi,tempo aggiunto,piccoli potenziamenti..I soldi sono molto importanti perchè alla fine di ogni ondata potrete comprare dei potenziamenti coi soldi che avete guadagnato,che renderanno tutto più caotico e divertente.Questa modalitá a normale dura pochissimo,diverso il fatto se volete raggiungere il punteggio massimo in ogni livello,che dovrete sudare effettuando molte combo.Realizzare le combo in sequenza sará molto difficile,perchè dopo un po' di tempo che non uccidete un nemico il contatore delle combo ripartirá,stessa cosa se sarete colpiti.In modalitá survival dovrete affrontare sempre molte ordate di nemici che aumenteranno di difficoltá di ondata a ondata,ma naturalmente potrete comprarvi dei potenziamenti,ricevere una vita extra da un nemico ucciso o un po' di tempo in più.Questa modalitá potrebbe benissimo stancare alla lunga,ma verrete invogliati dalla classifica mondiale,che vi fará ripetere i livelli numerose volte per battere il punteggio degli altri giocatori.Il risultato è un gioco estremamente adrenalinico e veloce che nonostante il suo gameplay semplice e " vecchio stile " saprá tenervi incollati ore al pc

21493472.review:
Like the devs say, its a action fast-paced shooter inspired by Super Pang. It's definitely got the "spiritual successor" vibe down and unlike Super Pang, it gives a lot more variety not only in complex gameplay, but in the backstory of where you are in the game. You don't have to think too hard to play this game, but it's just the right amount of intensity that'll have your nose up to the screen with such tight focus. The theme is sci-fi (true sci-fi, not the sci-fantasy bullshit you usually see in most games) and I love it. Tight controls, though the dash requires some mastering. Other than that, just imagine some tight retro "wave" gameplay with a cartoon adapted style and you have yourself Bug Butcher. 

Don't get it if these things aspects don't peak your interest.

21380124.review:
This is a positive review - but one thing should be made clear: this game doesn't have much in common with Super Pang (AKA Buster Brothers).

Super Pang is a precise platforming game where you methodically wore down bubbles while being careful and picking your moments.  You tapped the fire key with a deliberate rhythym to hit just the thing you wanted, and because you normally could only have one shot on the screen you were defenseless for a while if you wasted a shot.  You don't play Bug Butcher that way; you play Bug Butcher with the fire button held down, you shoot everything you can until there's nothing left, and you do it fast and loose and sometimes you take some damage (in Super Pang, you died in a single hit, which really changes the feel).  Both games have bouncing things, but deep-down they're very different games.

But anyway, yeah, Bug Butcher is a good action shooter; sometimes it feels like sort of a "bullet hell platformer" maybe?  Great music, fun atmosphere, really satisfying powerups, and good variety of enemies and challenges.  Solid game.

21222437.review:
Forget about why your character can only shoot up. If this game looks remontely interesting to you, try the demo. If you like that then buy the game - you won't be disappointed. It is short (30 levels) but unlike many other games it never becomes tedious or starts repeating itself to give you 10,000 hours of playtime. The controls are great, the music fitting, and each level adds a new component or combination not previously seen. 

The game has an appropriate level of challenge where you know you could have moved your exterminator better or used a power up or shot a different bug so you will be compelled to try a level "one more time" after failing - at which point you're hooked and end up beating the game in one or two sittings.

It's also not difficult to get all the achievements. 

A big thumbs up for simple, smooth enjoyment.

21217426.review:
[b]The Bug Butcher[/b] is an action indie game with both singleplayer and co-op gameplay.
If this review is too long for you, I suggest you to only read the first paragraph about the game's content and the final verdict at the end.

[h1]What is happening in the game:[/h1]
If you're similar with Pang or maybe Bubble Trouble, this is exactly the same type of game. You have to shoot the enemies that are bouncing around the room and the only direction you can shoot at is upwards. You play as The Butcher, who specialises in killing monsters in this exact same situation.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Gameplay[/b] | It's always nice to see when somebody makes a remake of an old classic game, but these remakes are usually just counting on player's nostalgia, instead of making a genuinely good game. Fortunately, this is not the case in The Bug Butcher. The gameplay is smooth and works as well as it should. It doesn't change the principle it's based on, but enhances it.
    [*][b]Graphics[/b] | This game has a really nice colourful appearance that really makes this game stand out. I mean, just look at the Store page screenshots! All the effects look really nice, although they can get for a slight bit too confusing at times.
    [*][b]Weapons[/b] | There are different weapons in this game and you can also get a lot of upgrades and pickups that boost your performance, for example faster shooting. Variety plays a really important role in this remake.
    [*][b]Co-op[/b] | You can of course also play with your buddy, if you're having him in your home. There is also controller support, so you don't have to be cramped on the same keyboard.
    [*][b]Pricing[/b] | For such a nice game, I don't think $8 is a lot. It has hours and hours of gameplay, Steam Achievements and Leaderboards.
    [*][b]Stages[/b] | There are 30 story-based stages in different environments and there are also survival mission for both singleplayer and co-op modes. This is great if you want more fun after you completed the story missions.
[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
    [*][b]Controller Chaos[/b] | So, this game sometimes doesn't really let me play with my keyboard. The controls in game are always appearing as controller buttons, but in the options menu, everything is shown as keyboard buttons. This can be sometimes very confusing.
    [*][b]Learning Curve[/b] | Although this game is very easy to understand, it becomes too hard a little to quickly. But that is just my opinion.
[/list]

[h1]The final verdict:[/h1]
This game is a really nice remake of old classic called Pang and it's really well-made. The graphics are awesome, there is even some story included. The confusion with controller/keyboard controls are the biggest problem in this game I see.
For its price, I think this game is definitely worth checking out as it offers quite a lot of fun.

Greetings,
BirdCute

[quote]Note that my copy of this game was obtained for free for reviewing purposes. However, this did not affect the quality and objectivity of this review.[/quote]

21212930.review:
Le jeu se présente comme un héritier de Pang avec pour particularité de ne pouvoir tirer qu'en l'air. Cela a son importance pour appréhender les niveaux et la destruction des ennemis.
Les contrôles sont très simples : trois boutons et deux directions. Sur une manette xbox, le X correspond au pouvoir spécial qui possède une jauge à remplir en tuant des ennemis. Le A pour tirer (Autofire quand maintenu) et B pour le dash (très utile dans certains cas).
Sur le plan graphique, le jeu est vraiment très joli et mignon. Si j'avais un reproche, c'est le manque de grosses différences entre les décors. Je pense aussi que la lisibilité est la priorité et pour ça, c'est gagné. La direction artistique est réussie avec des ennemis au look très cartoon.


Sur le plan gameplay, chaque monde a une particularité sauf le premier. Par exemple, des barrières de chaque côté, des plateformes, une presse,... Les ennemis sont tous différents et ont une fâcheuse tendance à se diviser quand on les détruit. Une partie du plaisir vient de la découverte de ces magnifiques bestioles.
Pour faire la transition entre les niveaux, les développeurs ont ajouté un niveau d'ascenseur qui, lui aussi, a ses petites particularités. Tout sauf reposant, ils peuvent être assez retors.

Comme si cela ne suffisait pas, il faut aussi des pouvoirs pour rendre le jeu particulièrement frénétique parce que l'une des très bonnes idées est de pouvoir cumuler le pouvoir que l'on possède déjà par défaut en tuant les ennemis avec ceux qui tombent sur le terrain (Idem que les ennemis, l'un des plaisirs reste de les découvrir) : Il suffit d'avoir la seringue d'adrénaline couplé à un power up de vitesse pour avoir son personnage qui ressemble à un speedy gonzales sous speed. Jouissif.
Par contre, les pouvoirs sont limités par le temps ou l'utilisation (l'autofire n'étant plus une bonne option dans ce cas).

J'ai déjà parlé des ennemis différents, du fait que l'on ne peut tirer qu'en l'air et pas de l'apparition des ennemis. Ils ne viennent pas tous du plafond pour faciliter la tâche. Ils peuvent venir du haut, des côtés et du bas. Très vite, on comprend qu'il ne vaut mieux pas rester en dessous de la trappe en espérant éliminer une partie de la menace même si le compteur de combo en dépend.
Le jeu a une dimension scoring avec une jauge de combos qui augmente à chaque ennemi tué, diminue progressivement entre deux morts et se réinitialise à chaque fois que le personnage est touché. De plus, les ennemis lâchent des pièces à récolter pour augmenter son score. A la fin de chaque niveau, il y a un tableau de score avec les points gagnés et le meilleur combo à réaliser.
Pour motiver un peu plus le joueur, à chaque fin de niveau, des pièces sont récupérés pour améliorer son personnage : power up, arme de base et vitesse. C'est un petit plus sympa.

Pour finir et être plus dans mon ressenti. C'est un jeu très facile à prendre en main avec une difficulté progressive. Il est fun instantanément et addictif. Pour les amateurs de shmup ou ceux qui cherchent un petit jeu à faire, c'est le candidat parfait.

Je précise que j'ai fini le mode arcade sans chercher le scoring. Le mode panique est très fun en co-op tout comme en solo : En gros, c'est un mode sans fin où il faut tenir le plus longtemps possible et l'argent récolté permet de prendre des upgrades.

21147596.review:
쏠수록 분열하고 분열하는 벌레들을 쏴서 터트리는 슈팅 게임.

옛날 오락실 게임 중에 팡(PANG)이라는 게임이 있었다. 한정된 방 안에서 좌우로 이동하며 통통 튀는 공들을 쏘는 게임이었는데, 공을 쏴서 맞출 때마다 딱 반절 크기의 두 개의 공으로 분열되는 것이 독특한 게임이었다. 그리고 버그 버쳐는 팡이라는 게임의 영향을 강하게 받은 게임이다. 

기본적으로는 각 방안에 등장하는 벌레들을 전부 쏴서 터뜨리는 슈팅 게임이다. 크기가 큰 벌레들을 터뜨리면 보다 작은 크기의 녀석들이 분열되어 나타난다. 이런 식으로 증식하는 벌레들을 남김없이 전부 쏘아 터뜨려야 한다. 

다양한 특성을 지닌 벌레들이 등장한다. 각 웨이브마다 쉴틈없이 벌레가 쏟아져나온다. 벌레들을 쏘아 터뜨리다보면 특수능력 활용에 필요한 게이지도 금방금방 차고, 파워업이라던지 다른 종류의 무기들이 자주 등장한다. 전반적으로 게임의 템포가 꽤나 빠른편이라 정신없이 벌레들을 쏘는 맛이 훌륭하다. 그래도 각 레벨마다 적의 등장 패턴이 항상 똑같다보니 어느 정도 암기 방식으로 게임을 진행할 수도 있게 된다.

생각보다 난이도는 어렵지 않은 편이다. 이지/노멀/하드 총 세 가지 난이도가 있는데, 특히나 이지 난이도는 라이프가 8개다보니 손 놓는 수준이 아니라면 죽기가 더 힘들 정도다. 하드는 라이프가 1개라 한 번 실수하면 죽긴 하지만, 특수장비 중에 한 번 실수를 면해주는 장비도 있고 게임 자체가 생각보다 어렵지 않은데다가 어차피 한 대 맞으면 콤보가 끊기는 것도 있고 하니, 자신이 조금이라도 게임 실력에 자신이 있다 싶으면 하드를 골라서 플레이해보자. 

그밖에 로컬 코옵도 지원되고 무한 슈팅 모드인 패닉 모드도 지원한다. 슈팅 게임으로써의 재미는 대단히 훌륭한 편이다. 아케이드 모드의 길이가 짧은 것이 살짝 아쉽긴 하다만, 레벨 하나하나는 정말 무한한 몰입도를 자랑한다. 

고전 오락실 게임 팡을 떠올리게 만들어준 매우 훌륭한 게임. 이것만으로도 충분히 갓겜 반열에 들만한 훌륭한 게임이지만, 온라인 코옵이 안 된다는 것이 못내 아쉽다. 온라인 코옵이 가능했다면 더 많은 사랑을 받는 게임이 됐을 것이다.

21139734.review:
At first you're like, Pang? then you're like, Shoot 'em up? then you're like... Ohh yeah, it's bug Butcher time!

If you're a fan of shoot'em ups of games like electronic super joy, you're probably going to really enjoy this. There is a lot of action on the screen at times and while to the extent of something like Ikaruga, it does provide a welcome alternative to the space ship shooters without the need of a platform jumper.

However, those looking for a class Pang remake may be a little disappointed at first, but surprisingly pleased by the out come. It gives a nice, faster, more up beat game play as well as a few new weapons to play with giving a refreshed feel, if you don't mind the missing ropes.

Gameplay wise, there isn't really much in the way of upgrades for the character. I think I managed to max out everything I could in the first few hours. The game has a nice tutorial to get you into the swing of things and you'll soon be awarded with new weapons to use and upgrade. 
As you progress you've presented with new bugs to kill, each with their own abilities and things you need to watch out for and different means of dealing with them. Some rooms have different envo hazards you need to watch out for, or use to your own advantage.

I've like to see Steam workshop support added, a basic level editor for community levels to make things interesting. Right now there is the fixed path of the single player mode, that once beat on hard (it is btw) you'll only be able to get higher scores againt world and friends. The alternatives are co op and the endless mode where you kill bugs for extra time pickups. You play until time runs out or you die. The Co-op is nice and is well suited for TV gameplay.

As it stands, it's well worth the asking price.

21124234.review:
Оригинал здесь - http://www.vgblogs.ru/2016/02/the-bug-butcher-mnenie.html

По сравнению с ранней версией изменений не так много, разве что разработчики реализовали весь обещанный функционал. Игра по-прежнему очень сильно напоминает мультфильм благодаря красивой двухмерной картинке, а с непривычки способна довести до потных ладоней даже бывалого стрелка на средней сложности. Но стоит почувствовать и понять ритм, немножко прокачаться в главном меню на заработанные тяжким трудом деньги и выучить повадки противников, как вам по зубам становятся казавшиеся невозможными множители комбо. Отважный дезинсектор Гарри под вашим чутким контролем демонстрирует чудеса ловкости, вышибает дух из пришельцев и зарабатывает на уровнях какое-то сумасшедшее количество очков.

И по прошествии некоторого времени вы ловите себя на мысли, что крепко-накрепко "подсели". The Bug Butcher отличается от всех прочих горизонтальных скролл-шутеров своим плавным темпом, помноженным на удивительную простоту и ненавязчивость. Новичков, только-только включившихся в процесс, порадует то, что сложность наращивают неспеша. С первой попытки, конечно, не получится вскарабкаться на верхние строчки таблицы лидеров, как и без сопутствующих модификаций арсенала и полезнейших перков. Но могу гарантировать, что вы вернётесь в игру ещё не раз и не два, чтобы побить свой же прошлый рекорд.

К тому же проект Awfully Nice идеально укладывается в формат незамысловатого лихого побоища на четверть часа. Каждый уровень пробегается всего за две-три минуты (а обычно и того меньше), поэтому много времени зачистка даже целого этажа исследовательского комплекса не займёт.

Отрадно, что полная версия приключений отважного космического истребителя жуков, спасающего учёных на удалённой планете, за совершенно смешные деньги предлагает гораздо больше контента, чем можно было бы подумать. Напряжённая аркадная кампания из тридцати уровней наверняка займёт надолго, ведь хочется её не просто пробежать мимоходом, но и побить рекорды, и конечно же получить все три звезды. В дополнительном режиме "Паники" всего пять арен, на которых нужно выживать, выживать и ещё раз выживать вопреки всему. Но дело осложняется тем, что просто отстреливать накатывающие хаотичные волны противников недостаточно: помимо жуков против вас играет и таймер - нужно собирать бонусные секунды, выпадающие из их лопающихся тушек, и золотые монетки для покупки апгрейдов прямо на поле боя.

При желании и первой же возможности к указанному стоит подключить и верного напарника. К сожалению, кооперативная игра возможна строго локальная, так что запасайтесь парочкой геймпадов. Ну или разучивайте раскладку клавиатуры, хотя подобный метод ввода сам по себе проверка на прочность.

Показательно, что The Bug Butcher невозможно критиковать и ругать на пустом месте. Да и не особо-то и хотелось... Авторы настолько хорошо понимали, чего хотят добиться в процессе разработки, что отполировали каждый элемент до зеркального блеска. Приключения забавно бормочущего Гарри затягивают как трясина и заставляют перепроходить изученные вдоль и поперёк уровни не ради достижений или поиска тайного смысла, а просто так, из интереса. А бодрая электронная музыка фоном создаёт особую атмосферу бесшабашного космического приключения.

В общем, если вы ждёте ещё каких-то рекомендаций, то напрасно.

Дисклеймер: ревью-код

21057033.review:
[b]Score[/b]
✰80%✰

[b]Pros[/b]
~Well-animated characters
~Balanced, satisfying and sometimes chaotic gameplay
~High replay value
~Free demo
~Cheap

[b]Cons[/b]
~Lack of any advanced challenges
~Lack of game modes
~No online multiplayer
~Menu navigation is a pain

First, I would like to address the elephant in the room. Yes, this game is essentially a 90's arcade darling "Pang" with a fresh coat of paint. I used to love going out with my parents for dinner, because most pub restaurants around at the time had arcade machines. Pang was one of my favourites, because it was obvious just from looking at the screen what you had to do, so you needn't fear wasting your cherished pocket money just to learn the ropes.

The Bug Butcher takes the simplistic and enjoyable core gameplay of Pang and shakes it up just enough so that you wouldn't call it a clone, but you can tell from first glance that it is clearly paying homage. Actually, that isn't giving it enough credit, I would personally say that The Bug Butcher is superior in every way. It's faster paced, rarely feels unfair and has a much better aesthetic.

Rather than "harpooning balls", you play the roll of Harry, a badass bug exterminator, called into a laboratory that has become totally infested with giant mutant creepy crawlies. As Harry, you can only shoot directly upwards, which works out just fine because this is where the majority of critters come into his crosshairs. Most bugs either bounce off the floor over the top of you or fly around. Some will fire projectiles at you, while others will crawl along the roof and try to eat your scientist friends by snagging them on their long tongues. A lot of the chunkier bugs will split into smaller bugs after you've given them a good zapping, adding to the chaos.

Fortunately you rarely find yourself overwhelmed thanks to the wide range of weapons and power-ups available. These range from a high-speed rail gun to a freeze bomb that turns all bugs to ice for a few seconds. No matter what method you use to butcher bugs, each different weapon and power-up feels extremely satisfying, each packing a lot of power compared to your standard blaster which is itself still extremely punchy and enjoyable to use. This is probably down to a combination of audio-visual thump and some precise, responsive controls.

Every bug killed drops more coins for you to spend on passive bonuses that stay permanent throughout the 30 level main arcade campaign. These can increase your damage, power-up duration and increase your combo time. Personally, I always went with the 30% speed boost. The combo system allows you to rack up major points by slaughtering bugs in quick succession, the combo meter itself gets reset every time you take damage or don't land a kill after a couple of seconds. If you're aiming for a perfect rank on each level, you're going to have to get a perfect string of combos throughout the whole level. This becomes much easier when you play the levels again later after having invested coins into more firepower, but can be a source of frustration for the perfectionists when their combo breaks toward the end of the level.

There are two modes included with the game. The first is the Arcade mode, which puts you through 30 levels of increasing difficulty with a new environmental hazard introduced every 5 levels. These include things like floating platforms, laser walls, and a giant hammer that periodically smashes everything underneath. Completing a level will give you a score and a rank out of four stars. Three of these are awarded for reaching a certain score, while the fourth is awarded for a specific number of combos made. Unfortunately, these 30 levels will be over before you know it and leave you wanting more. There are also no boss bugs, despite what the trailer for the game claims. Although the difficulty curve seems to be highly polished, likely from player feedback while the game was in Early Access, I felt it didn't go far enough with the challenge.

The other game mode is called Panic, which will simply throw waves and waves of monsters at you until you are overwhelmed or run out of time. Time can be boosted in this mode, as bugs you've destroyed will frequently drop items that add more time to the counter. So far I've never come close to running out of time. I've found myself totally bombarded with bugs long before that happens. You can also buy power-ups and weapons in this mode from the pause menu, but they only last for the game you're currently in. There is also a two-player co-op version of Panic mode, where if one player dies the other player can revive them, but if just one of you perishes, then it's game over for you both. The multiplayer aspect shows a lot of promise, but it would be a lot better if there were perhaps larger maps for up to four players. It's also local co-op only, there's no online play here. Panic mode might seem like the answer to the lack of challenge on the Arcade mode, but you have to suffer through a lot of repetitive easy waves before the challenge starts to ramp up.

The graphics are sharp and colourful. Each type of bug has a truly unique design and are animated well. They also squish and burst in a way that feels immensely satisfying but doesn't gross you out. Add to that the sound effects which all feel base-like and appropriate for what's happening, from the sound of your gun, to the sticky squish noises of the bugs bouncing. Harry himself stands out well from the backgrounds and all the other objects flying around the stages. I never had an issue with knowing where I was or what dangerous thing was coming towards me. A combination of the camera tracking and Harry's character design, and his eccentric movement all helped. The game shows you in advance where bugs are going to appear from, giving you time to get out of the way if you're standing on a trap door where an insect eruption is imminent.

Aside from the bugs that are supposed to be there, I didn't encounter many problems with the game at all. I did experience a very irritating glitch on the final level of Arcade mode where no bugs were spawning on the final wave, while the background was flashing and glitching up, until I eventually ran out of time and had to repeat it. The UI for the menus is also a mess, with some buttons being labelled and others not. It was clearly designed for a touch-screen or mouse, yet the game itself is best played with a controller. Even without a controller plugged in, it will give you button prompts based on the Xbox controller layout. There are also no options to adjust basic video settings like resolution and refresh rate. The game will run at whatever your desktop resolution is set to, though this should be fine for most people (high refresh-rate displays also work just fine).

The Bug Butcher is a fantastic, highly polished arcade game that unfortunately feels a little barebones, like the framework for a highly re-playable and addictive game is in place, but needs fleshing out to realise its full potential. However, it's well worth the $8 asking price, especially if you have a friend you can do some couch co-op with. Really, the only major gripe I have with this game is that I want more.

Zgniatacz Robali wywołał niemałe poruszenie, kiedy gdzieś na gikzie zwiastun został podwieszony. No bo jak to? Takie prymitywne to to, strzela się  tylko w górę i co to ma być za wykastrowana Contra. Racji w tym mało, bo nie Contro, a jak już to reanimacja miodnego Pang! które w swoim czasie rządziło.

Faktycznie, strzela się tylko w górę na niewielkich arenach do pluskiew i innych kosmicznych paści jakie akurat wypełzają ze wszelkich otworów umiejscowionych skrzętnie na planszy. Jako, że zgodnie z tytułem, wcielamy się w rasowego specjalistę od odrobaczania miejscówek nie pozostaje nam nic innego jak stłamsić to kosmiczne plugastwo. Giwera w łapę idziemy zamiatać.

Nie upatrujcie tu jakiejś ciężkiej strawy science fiction, ósmych pasażerów czy ukrytych wymiarów. The Bug Butcher (oficjalne www) nie grzeszy wysokim stopniem skomplikowania, ale podobnie jak i jego pierwowzór nie skąpi miodności wylewającej się z ekranu, na tyle obfitej, że należy pod niego podstawić wiadro. Zwłaszcza w potyczkach wspólnych, kiedy to na jednym ekranie robicie z gry kanapowca i razem idziecie w bój. Same robale to dość gumowe istoty, które odbijają się po planszach, co idealnie wpasowuje się w założenia zabawy. A to nie tyle odbijające się piłeczki, co wredne mofos czy to rzygające pociskami, trującymi glutami czy mnożące się szybciej niż ameby kreatury. Rodzajów ich jest kilka, ale nie pozostajemy im dłużni. O ile oczywiście w grę nie wchodzą modyfikatory samych plansz, gdzie na naszej drodze stają bariery laserowe czy platformy rodem z Arkanoida, skutecznie wypaczające dotychczas ograne zachowania przeciwników. A nasze pukawki strzelają nieustannie, czy to ogniem mocno zaporowym, czy też dopalonym przez wszędobylskie znajdźki, właściwie power upy, i ulepszenie zakupowane za walutę zdobytą za kolejne rozkładające się truchło. Standardowo, a jednocześnie prosto i przyjemnie, zarówno dla wyjadaczy jak i świeżynek. Wisienką na torcie jest fajowska kreską w którą Bug Butcher został ubrany przez co żaden piksel oka nie wykole, a i gra zestarzeje się godnie.

Nie to co Pang! Był fantastyczny i dużo godzin zabrał, a teraz jest go czym zastąpić. Wreszcie.
